entry.title: Glass Rain
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 223,363Chapters: 48/53Kudos: 1,720

Summary: Jason Todd wakes up in the wrong Gotham. Here, he stayed dead. Here, his death broke his family so completely they became the monsters they once fought. Dick Grayson haunts the skyline with wings and talons, Barbara Gordon moves like a spider made of shadow, and something that might have once been Batman rules from a corrupted cave. The city is quarantined, the air tastes of ozone and old blood, and Jason should be running. Instead, he finds himself drawn to the creature that was once his brother—the one stalking him through twisted streets with eyes that still burn with something almost human. Some hunts, it turns out, go both ways.

entry.title: Common Grounds
entry.summary:
Author: MewSefet

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,910Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 147

Summary: What happens when you accidently start dating your son's English teacher? When Dick and Jason find themselves pushed together on a rainy day in their usual coffee shop, neither of them expect their lives are already intertwined. How casual flirting and mutual interest turns into dating, turns into an identity reveal that neither of them expect, but should have figured out earlier. Eg. the Detective!Dick Grayson/Teacher!Jason Todd fic that no one asked for. Including Jason is Damian's teacher, and Damian is 80% Dick's son and identity shenanigans in a Civillian!AU.

entry.title: seven days at the country club
entry.summary:
Author: almostnowandthen

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,774Chapters: 2/7Kudos: 49

Summary: The Wayne Enterprises Board wants Dick, Jason and Tim, to film a documentary commemorating the life and legacy of Bruce Wayne. Except, Bruce Wayne may or may not be actually dead, and it's kind of hard to act like a normal, all-American family in front of the camera, when off-screen, they're getting busy getting on each other's nerves, or in each other's pants. Will they finish the shoot, or will they get kicked out of the country club for various forms of misconduct before the end of the week?

entry.title: Kintsugi Scars
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,462Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 33

Summary: Joker had been too busy to spend much time with him. The clown had had his fun, sure. But nothing Dick was unable to suffer through until help came. Nothing broken. Only a few new scars. The drive back to the manor was tense and silent. A few stitches later and some painkillers later, he was sent off to get some food and rest. “…so fucking…” Jason’s voice is muffled against Dick’s shoulder, almost too much to hear. “-ing to lose you.” “I’m okay, little wing,” he repeats. Soft. Jason needs soft right now. The pieces of him are fragile, delicately slotted together. Every sharp edge and crack vibrant. Kintsugi scars. Dick traces one of them, the one that tracks through his hairline. _____ The Joker leaves scars. Dick and Jason put together each other's pieces.

Summary: In which Jason and Dick became best friends and fell in love before Bruce took Jason in and when Dick was still Robin. But that doesn't mean that love is ever easy. Dick sighs and shakes his head, exasperated. “So who is he?” he asks. “Some newly orphaned kid, like I was?” “His name is Jason Todd,” Bruce tells him. entry.title: The Dynamic Duo
entry.summary:
Author: sarriathmg

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,847Chapters: 4/34Kudos: 156

Summary: Having been Batman for four years, Dick Grayson still hasn't gotten used to the heaviness of the cowl. Now, investigating a mass disappearance case that happened a few days ago in a late-night diner, Dick meets a young street rat who's had friends tangled up in the same web. Jason Todd has all the traits Dick saw in himself when he first started—curious, shrewd, agile, and, most importantly, wanting to do good. Despite Dick's initial rejection of the boy, he starts to think that a long-term partnership isn't a bad idea. Perhaps four years have been long enough time for the current stasis. Perhaps, he thinks, it's time for his own Robin.
